body: OK, ready, won't merge as requested since you want to do this.
Great. Let's merge if no one objects 24 hours from now.
Let me know if you need anything else done with this PR before it is merged.  Thanks
What exactly are we gaining by the switch? Is the new system actively maintained?
Weâ€™re gaining not being dependent on (occasionally fragile) Oracle servers.
Just to be clear: we still depend on the Oracle server for uploads (https://hg.netbeans.org/binaries/upload), so oracle can not yet drop the server.
Absolutely true. However, by means of this PR we can switch away from Oracle, plus Emilian has instructions for how to upload to there.

> Just to be clear: we still depend on the Oracle server for uploads (https://hg.netbeans.org/binaries/upload), so oracle can not yet drop the server.

The NetBeans PPMC has SSH keys to the OSUOSL server. It's totally possible to upload new files there and start using it.
Thank you! Merging.
@junichi11 I only took a quick look, but in general it looked good. The tests are indeed broken before, so it would say: Lets get this in.

Please note: I'll update the PR with the corrected maven coordinates. We don't need to play commit ping-pong for a single char change. I'm currently doing a test build locally, if that succeeds, I'll push the squashed commits and will mark that commit, that this PR should be closed. You will stay the author in the final squashed commit.

Thank you!

@matthiasblaesing I've checked only the license headers. Other than one file should be OK. However, I'm worried about removing trailing whitespaces. These are test data. So, they may(or may not) be added intentionally. I think that we should not remove them if possible until the tests are fixed.

That problem is not limited to NetBeans. A user can also run the command with the specific file via terminal, actually.
I think that PHPStan should handle the problem automatically because PHPStan knows it. That way, other tools can also integrate PHPStan safely and easily.

I asked about the logo via also Twitter but we cannot get the reply yet. So we will use the current icon at the moment.(It's easy to change it later :)) I'm going to fix this feature when the command is improved.

If there is no problem, let's merge.
Should Grails project template be hidden or deleted or is its version not too old?

For Java application, even if module-info.java is present, Classpath JavaClasspathConstants.MODULE_SOURCE_PATH is not set, so in ProxyFileManager createFactories FileManager gets created with outputFileManager, from where the type gets found. Provided localized fix.
Makes sense. Are there objections to this? Otherwise lets merge in 24 hours.

@matthiasblaesing , I think I did misunderstand you. There was a lot more going on here. I see that the old jar contained Jsp Api, Servlet Api, El Api, and schema files. I have added the EL, JSP, Servlet and JSP Api jars separately and added licenses for them. Does this look like the right way to approach this?
CC @tzezula.
Looks fine to me.
@matthiasblaesing please review the changes

I would go this way: Run the unittests for j2ee.kit on master - not which tests fail, rerun with this patchset applied, compare. If the same number or less unittests fail, merge it. @juneau001 it would be great if you could do it.

Thank you I pushed a slightly modified changeset as:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/a8dbf8b18e01f7f73ff20879a897e7606e7c4d30

The problem was here:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/04cabc2740cc6e68f793583309d47cd9c12a27d9/enterprise/websvc.wsitconf/licenseinfo.xml#L39

The type is an enum - in this case you supply a "free-text" comment. That comment needs to supplied as content of the element. See difference here:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/a8dbf8b18e01f7f73ff20879a897e7606e7c4d30/enterprise/websvc.wsitconf/licenseinfo.xml#L39

I will run the tests and compare.  Thanks for the feedback!

The idea is sound, but it needs integration into the build system. The "old way" was to build the redistribution jars once and cache them on the binary server. I would not do that anymore. In the last days we learnt the hard way, that we should not rely on external systems (yes I know maven central belongs to that group).

Here is what I would do: Cover `servletjspapi` and `web.jspparser` in one PR (#906 is not enough) as they are both build similar and belong tightly together.

You already identified the API modules, but they need integration into the build process. Please see `enterprise/web.core.syntax` for a similar case. In that module the taglibs are downloaded from maven central and the documentation, that is then redistributed with netbeans, is build as `external/generated-*` (see `prepare-doc` target).

For `servletjspapi` you already identified the source file from maven central. These need to be filtered/unified as done in the `web.jspparser/build.xml` and a grouped license file needs to be created as in the reference module.

The sources for `web.jspparser` module are also available on maven central:
Jasper/JSP API: https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.web/javax.servlet.jsp/2.3.4/jar
EL: https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.web/javax.el/2.2.6/jar
Preprocessor-Util: https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.main.common/common-util/5.0/glassfish-jar
ClassLoaderUtil: https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.main.common/glassfish-ee-api/5.0/glassfish-jar

These jars need to be recombined and produces also a `generated*` file. 

The parser has unittests and I ask you to run them before and after your changes, to check that the parser still works.

The test scenario:
* start with empty user directory
* create new Java Frontend application project - `index.html` is one of created and opened files
* try code [knockout](http://knockoutjs.com) completion in HTML - e.g. the `data-bind` directive
    * check the support for knockout completion is enabled
* execute the project - app opens in new window, *DOM Inspector* opens in the IDE
    * check the *DOM Inspector* window is opened and selecting an element in it selects it in the application window

Looks like all of the above is working after 6b75cf4 change.
Shall we merge this?
OK, merging, this has been reviewed a lot and everyone is happy.

Please use only the elephant w/o any background. Icons nowadays are not full filled anymore and not needed too. See fontawesome or other icons. Thx. The other one is not looking good and will not fit into the design.

But I like the pie chart more, I mean we can use the icon not for the results, but for the integration into the inspect section the pie chart for the result. IMHO it doesn't have to be the exact phpstan icon.

This will support 5.3.0 too of course and Java 11.

We won't to postpone the release 2.22.1 too much.

No big deal. Low risk change with large benefit - opening a file with a trait will not longer kill all your groovy editing.
Side effects should be small, if registration is ok nobody will notice anything, if something goes wrong we will see immediatley. Is already cooking in my daily IDE for quite some time.

Risk to degrade something as part of code completion in Groovy code exists, but seems to be small, because a lot of things do not really work in code completion in Groovy code at the moment. It should make a lot of things better and I am trying to get all the failing code completion tests (already failing before my change or with wrong results) green by going through all of them as a separate effort. This change is part of my daily work IDE for quite some time now.

Cannot reproduce failure from @matthiasblaesing with a clean checkout and merged PR. Builds fine locally. Cannot test on travis with getting Groovy is as part of the testes build. Feels like a deadlock.

Reason is:
```
 [nb-javac] /home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/groovy/groovy.kit/test/qa-functional/src/org/netbeans/modules/groovy/qaf/GrailsTestCase.java:28: error: package org.netbeans.jellytools.modules.j2ee.nodes does not exist

```

How to take this further?

@svenreimers All `/external/*-license.txt` are files for /external/binraries-list.(`*-license.txt` depends on a binary name.) So I suggest that you insert contents of antlr2-license and asm-license.txt into groovy-2.5.2-license.txt directly. I did so before. See the old license file(groovy-all-2.4.5-license.txt).

ant -Dcluster.config=groovy verify-libs-and-licenses

and check the resulting file: `nbbuild/build/verifylibsandlicenses.xml`. This of course only catches formating problems.

>  as there is not yet an established way to directly upload to the new system

`scp` should work, you just need to rename the dependency using that "SHA1 + name" format.

Not saying this to insist on using OSUOSL, it's up to the PPMC to decide. But there's SSH and you have a folder there. Adding a new dependency is just copying a new file.

@matthiasblaesing ,  I have mavenized web.jspparser and servletjspapi modules here and I have unified the jars, and I have added licenses for them. I have a couple of questions though : 
1) What should be the license for the new jars created after unification? Do they even require a license, as they are built in runtime ?
2) Does the target `create-jars-from-glassfish` in web.jspparser even executed anytime? I ask this because it tries to unify the jars from `{glassfish_location}` the value of which looks like a local address `/home/marfous/Programs/AppServers/glassfish-4.0-b84-custom` that doesn't even exist.

I have created a target `build-init` for unification of jars in both servletjspapi and web.jspparser

Also, it looks like the tests are broken for web.jspparser module, because I tried to run the unit tests with and without my changes and I see that in both the cases, it tries to unzip `project3.zip` from `test/unit/data` which isn't present. I am looking into this.
This is not for master but for release10 branch, once Laszlo creates it.

So, I think this is a great idea - but the patch is adding the libraries to the standard (platform) build, no? While I would appreciate that, this does not seem to be allowed per Apache rules due to the license?

I think this should be tackled differently. Generated source files are basicly useless under version control. They will rot and at some point stop working. The idea as I see it is:

- take the XSD
- assume that the license does not carry over to generated code
- distribute the generated code without the XSDs

I just realized how well the glassfish is licensed (I have yet to find a source file that has no license info).

So is there a source for the weblogic XSDs, so that we could get them at build time and generate the source files then?
